subject: Psychology
title: Flow and Optimal Experience
description: A micro-lesson that makes Flow and Optimal Experience usable.

hook.text: A musician plays for hours. Time vanishes. The self dissolves. Only the music exists. That's flow.

buildup.text: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi studied the state of flow â€” complete immersion in an activity that matches skill to challenge.

discovery.text: Flow occurs when challenge slightly exceeds skill. Too easy: boredom. Too hard: anxiety. Just right: flow.

twist.text: Flow is not relaxation. It's deep effort that feels effortless â€” a paradox at the heart of peak performance.

climax.text: Flow research shaped game design, education, sports psychology, and workplace productivity worldwide.

punchline.text: Happiness isn't comfort. It's being fully absorbed in something that matters.

quiz.question: When does flow occur according to Csikszentmihalyi?
options: When challenge slightly exceeds current skill level
When tasks are extremely easy and relaxing
When there is no challenge at all
